results.title: Seven days before you die [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nassiem Valamanesh, Andrei Gostin and MAPS
results.brief_description: A man recounts the 7 days leading up to his death when he is shadowed by a mysterious stranger in black. On day 6 he receives a strange package which instantly triggers a physical response, as well as strange visions which may or may not be related to the stranger. Cast includes Michael Kumnick, Roderick Ho’vell and a computer generated voice.
results.description: A man recounts the 7 days leading up to his death when he is shadowed by a mysterious stranger in black. results.title: Seven [Widescreen] (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Phyllis Carlyle, Arnold Kopelson and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. “Seven” is a film that portrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. “Seven” includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremeties of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters. Co-starring Gwyneth Paltrow and a diabolically good Kevin Spacey. Do not miss the opening credit sequence.

The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremeties of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters. Co-starring Gwyneth Paltrow and a diabolically good Kevin Spacey. Do not miss the opening credit sequence.

results.title: The Search for King Solomon's Mines for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette & cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: The Search for King Solomon’s Mines [computer game] for Commodore 64. The Search for King Solomon’s Mines is a single-player text adventure for the Commodore 64. It is the first part of a two part graphic adventure and allows for saving of the adventure for pauses during play.

results.title: Seven (Special edition) [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Phyllis Carlyle, Arnold Kopelson and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. “Seven” is a film that betrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. “Seven” includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremities of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters.

results.title: Settle down country
results.creator_credit: Pam Nathan, Jim Buckell, David Batty, NAIHO, CAAMA, CAAC and Western Deserts Oustations Council
results.brief_description: Documents the return of the Pintubi people to their own lands after many years on Government run settlements. Extensive use of archival footage offers an added historical perspective to this account of the efforts of these people to retain their cultural heritage. Based on the book of the same name by Dick Leichleitner Japanangka and Pam Nathan.

results.title: With Nang & Nakorn in Thailand
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, Heather MacAndrew, David Springbett and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of tow boys in the village of Con May in Thailand, including catching fish and lizards with their bare hands. The film also notes the building of a traditional Thai house on stilts, and highlights religion, extended family relationships and their use of technology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Singer, Heather MacAndrew, David Springbett and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions

results.title: With Michael in Kyuso, Kenya
results.creator_credit: David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses on the life of a young boy living in a village in Kenya. Shows the role of education, the links between the village and the towns and the impact of technology on employment prospects in the village.

results.title: With inertia
results.brief_description: A stylish exploration of life, death, friendship, drugs, work and unemployment. Five girls living in the city and on the edge, their fast and not so fast lives.

results.title: With Burning Patience
results.creator_credit: Antonio Skarmeta, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Prole Film and Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: A film of impassioned charm tracing the lives of little people caught up in large events. A haunting poetic drama which blends Chilean history at the time of the downfall of the Allende government in 1973, with a delicate village love story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Skarmeta, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Prole Film and Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion
